Major Case Response Team, led by Special Agent Leroy Jethro Gibbs.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0364845/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"shellemk","dateCreated":"2004-09-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"Time flies when you're enjoying yourself","reviewBody":"and each episode speeds along all too quickly! I LOVE this show ! What is there NOT to like? Rich story lines, strongly portrayed (and very human) personalities you can really warm to who play off each other brilliantly, all with their own distinctive quirks and  above all  the always wonderful Mark Harmon as main character! What more could you ask for in a show?! There's not a single character I'd change  none that irritate  they're all excellent. I consider it a bonus that it's the one thing on TV that all our family equally enjoy for different reasons. Even my father-in-law likes this and we normally have totally different viewing preferences! I was delighted when I heard that there was a second series imminent. Only problem is that living in England, who knows how long after it's shown in the US we'll get to see it! Fortunately it's worth the wait!","aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":134442,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.7,"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2003-09-23","keywords":"goth girl,babe scientist,special agent,naval criminal investigative service,police procedural","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001319/","name":"Mark Harmon","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0564724/","name":"David McCallum","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0615266/","name":"Sean Murray"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0114905/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0066107/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0183875/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0069074/","name":"Donald P. Major Case Response Team, led by Special Agent Leroy Jethro Gibbs.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0364845/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"shellemk","dateCreated":"2004-09-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"Time flies when you're enjoying yourself","reviewBody":"and each episode speeds along all too quickly! I LOVE this show ! What is there NOT to like? Rich story lines, strongly portrayed (and very human) personalities you can really warm to who play off each other brilliantly, all with their own distinctive quirks and  above all  the always wonderful Mark Harmon as main character! What more could you ask for in a show?! There's not a single character I'd change  none that irritate  they're all excellent. I consider it a bonus that it's the one thing on TV that all our family equally enjoy for different reasons. Even my father-in-law likes this and we normally have totally different viewing preferences! I was delighted when I heard that there was a second series imminent. Only problem is that living in England, who knows how long after it's shown in the US we'll get to see it! Major Case Response Team, led by Special Agent Leroy Jethro Gibbs." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt0364845/","name":"NCIS: Naval Criminal Investigative Service","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjVlMjZhYzYtOGQxNC00OTQxLTk2NzEtMWFmMmNhODA4YjYzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjQ3MDgwNjY@._V1_.jpg","description":"The cases of the Naval Criminal Investigative Service's Washington, D.C. Major Case Response Team, led by Special Agent Leroy Jethro Gibbs.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0364845/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"shellemk","dateCreated":"2004-09-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"Time flies when you're enjoying yourself","reviewBody":"and each episode speeds along all too quickly! I LOVE this show ! What is there NOT to like? Rich story lines, strongly portrayed (and very human) personalities you can really warm to who play off each other brilliantly, all with their own distinctive quirks and  above all  the always wonderful Mark Harmon as main character! What more could you ask for in a show?! There's not a single character I'd change  none that irritate  they're all excellent. I consider it a bonus that it's the one thing on TV that all our family equally enjoy for different reasons. Even my father-in-law likes this and we normally have totally different viewing preferences! I was delighted when I heard that there was a second series imminent. Only problem is that living in England, who knows how long after it's shown in the US we'll get to see it! I LOVE this show ! What is there NOT to like? programme.desc: FBI: Created by Craig Turk, Dick Wolf. With Missy Peregrym, Zeeko Zaki, Jeremy Sisto, Alana De La Garza. Procedural drama about the inner workings of the New York office of the FBI, bringing to bear all the Bureau's skills, intellect and mind-blowing technology to keep New York and the country safe." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt7491982/","name":"FBI","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTg5Mjg5NDk4OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjY1ODIyNjM@._V1_.jpg","description":"Procedural drama about the inner workings of the New York office of the FBI, bringing to bear all the Bureau's skills, intellect and mind-blowing technology to keep New York and the country safe.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt7491982/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"blueoysterdvp"},"dateCreated":"2020-01-22","inLanguage":"English","name":"A Tale Of Two Seasons","reviewBody":"Some viewers leaving comments here appear to be watching Season 2 only. If you have CBS All Access that can be understandable since they DON'T carry S1. For $10 bucks a month it should be available. Just watching S2 can get confusing if you haven't seen the much better Season One minus the "Most Wanted" episode. That episode was the Pilot for "FBI: Most Wanted" and not very good. The First Season of FBI was more suspenseful with better writing and plots. The same could be said for the characters. Where's Ian Lim been lately played by James Chen? A much better character than what looks like his replacement Kelly Moran played by Taylor Anthony Miller. Not a good replacement so far. Hopefully Chen comes back. A big loss for the show. Sela Ward as Dana Mosier was leaving after Season One no matter what. A huge loss. Her replacement Alana De La Garza as Isobel Castile has been a hit or miss affair. Horrible in S2 E1 "Little Egypt", better in every show after. Still no Dana though. John Boyd as Stuart Scola has been bringing S2 down. Why his "Barney Fife" character hasn't been written off the show is a better mystery than some of the S2 plots. His new partner Emily Ryder played by Catherine Haena Kim has been solid so far. She has a future in acting. Why Kristen Chazel (Ebonee Noel) was taken out of the field as Scola's partner is baffling. Maybe due to the absence of Iam at headquarters? S2 is not S1 yet. It's not bad either, though uneven. Viewers that don't watch or like FBI are going to give those One Star ratings that don't make sense. If it's a bonafide 1 Star show it would've been yanked off the air after 5 shows. For those folks, don't watch this show. If you watch more than 3 episodes such a low Star rating doesn't make sense. Anyway, I hope FBI gets back to the S1 caliber of writing and acting. After that "Most Wanted" episode in S1 I saw a giant Red Flag. "Little Egypt" S2's first episode was another flag. Hopefully they continue for the better. Maggie and OA got me interested in FBI from the start. The acting chemistry is there. Now give them the surrounding plots and characters that made S1 so good CBS. Put S1 on All Access too while you're at it!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":14311,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.9},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2018-09-25","keywords":"violence,police investigation,copaganda,fbi agent,fbi federal bureau of investigation","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1335291/","name":"Missy Peregrym"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4976368/","name":"Zeeko Zaki"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005438/","name":"Jeremy Sisto"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0019598/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0274041/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0046592/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1541762/","name":"Craig Turk"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0937725/","name":"Dick Wolf"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"First Look Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi251968281","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWM2YTdkNmItYzNhOC00MjBmLWExMDEtZmNmZWZhMTRjNjgwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWM2YTdkNmItYzNhOC00MjBmLWExMDEtZmNmZWZhMTRjNjgwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg","description":""}}</script><metacontent="

programme.review: IMDb data; ttnr: 7491982, Title: FBI, --- Description: FBI: Created by Craig Turk, Dick Wolf. With Missy Peregrym, Zeeko Zaki, Jeremy Sisto, Alana De La Garza. Procedural drama about the inner workings of the New York office of the FBI, bringing to bear all the Bureau's skills, intellect and mind-blowing technology to keep New York and the country safe." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt7491982/","name":"FBI","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTg5Mjg5NDk4OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjY1ODIyNjM@._V1_.jpg","description":"Procedural drama about the inner workings of the New York office of the FBI, bringing to bear all the Bureau's skills, intellect and mind-blowing technology to keep New York and the country safe.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt7491982/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"blueoysterdvp","dateCreated":"2020-01-22","inLanguage":"English","name":"A Tale Of Two Seasons","reviewBody":"Some viewers leaving comments here appear to be watching Season 2 only. If you have CBS All Access that can be understandable since they DON'T carry S1. For $10 bucks a month it should be available. Just watching S2 can get confusing if you haven't seen the much better Season One minus the "Most Wanted" episode. That episode was the Pilot for "FBI: Most Wanted" and not very good. The First Season of FBI was more suspenseful with better writing and plots. The same could be said for the characters. Where's Ian Lim been lately played by James Chen? A much better character than what looks like his replacement Kelly Moran played by Taylor Anthony Miller. Not a good replacement so far. Hopefully Chen comes back. A big loss for the show. Sela Ward as Dana Mosier was leaving after Season One no matter what. A huge loss. Her replacement Alana De La Garza as Isobel Castile has been a hit or miss affair. Horrible in S2 E1 "Little Egypt", better in every show after. Still no Dana though. John Boyd as Stuart Scola has been bringing S2 down. Why his "Barney Fife" character hasn't been written off the show is a better mystery than some of the S2 plots. His new partner Emily Ryder played by Catherine Haena Kim has been solid so far. She has a future in acting. Why Kristen Chazel (Ebonee Noel) was taken out of the field as Scola's partner is baffling. Maybe due to the absence of Iam at headquarters? S2 is not S1 yet. It's not bad either, though uneven. Viewers that don't watch or like FBI are going to give those One Star ratings that don't make sense. If it's a bonafide 1 Star show it would've been yanked off the air after 5 shows. For those folks, don't watch this show. If you watch more than 3 episodes such a low Star rating doesn't make sense. Anyway, I hope FBI gets back to the S1 caliber of writing and acting. After that "Most Wanted" episode in S1 I saw a giant Red Flag. "Little Egypt" S2's first episode was another flag. Hopefully they continue for the better. Maggie and OA got me interested in FBI from the start. The acting chemistry is there. Now give them the surrounding plots and characters that made S1 so good CBS. Put S1 on All Access too while you're at it!","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":14311,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.9,"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2018-09-25","keywords":"violence,police investigation,copaganda,fbi agent,fbi federal bureau of investigation","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1335291/","name":"Missy Peregrym","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4976368/","name":"Zeeko Zaki","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005438/","name":"Jeremy Sisto"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0019598/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0274041/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0046592/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1541762/","name":"Craig Turk","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0937725/","name":"Dick Wolf"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"First Look Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi251968281","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWM2YTdkNmItYzNhOC00MjBmLWExMDEtZmNmZWZhMTRjNjgwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWM2YTdkNmItYzNhOC00MjBmLWExMDEtZmNmZWZhMTRjNjgwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg","description":""</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 7491982, Title: FBI, --- Description: FBI: Created by Craig Turk, Dick Wolf. With Missy Peregrym, Zeeko Zaki, Jeremy Sisto, Alana De La Garza. Procedural drama about the inner workings of the New York office of the FBI, bringing to bear all the Bureau's skills, intellect and mind-blowing technology to keep New York and the country safe." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt7491982/","name":"FBI","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTg5Mjg5NDk4OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjY1ODIyNjM@._V1_.jpg","description":"Procedural drama about the inner workings of the New York office of the FBI, bringing to bear all the Bureau's skills, intellect and mind-blowing technology to keep New York and the country safe.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt7491982/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"blueoysterdvp","dateCreated":"2020-01-22","inLanguage":"English","name":"A Tale Of Two Seasons","reviewBody":"Some viewers leaving comments here appear to be watching Season 2 only. If you have CBS All Access that can be understandable since they DON'T carry S1. For $10 bucks a month it should be available. Just watching S2 can get confusing if you haven't seen the much better Season One minus the "Most Wanted" episode. That episode was the Pilot for "FBI: Most Wanted" and not very good. The First Season of FBI was more suspenseful with better writing and plots. The same could be said for the characters. Where's Ian Lim been lately played by James Chen? A much better character than what looks like his replacement Kelly Moran played by Taylor Anthony Miller. Not a good replacement so far. Hopefully Chen comes back. A big loss for the show. Sela Ward as Dana Mosier was leaving after Season One no matter what. A huge loss. Her replacement Alana De La Garza as Isobel Castile has been a hit or miss affair. Horrible in S2 E1 "Little Egypt", better in every show after. Still no Dana though. John Boyd as Stuart Scola has been bringing S2 down. Why his "Barney Fife" character hasn't been written off the show is a better mystery than some of the S2 plots. His new partner Emily Ryder played by Catherine Haena Kim has been solid so far. She has a future in acting. Why Kristen Chazel (Ebonee Noel) was taken out of the field as Scola's partner is baffling. Maybe due to the absence of Iam at headquarters? S2 is not S1 yet. It's not bad either, though uneven. Viewers that don't watch or like FBI are going to give those One Star ratings that don't make sense. If it's a bonafide 1 Star show it would've been yanked off the air after 5 shows. For those folks, don't watch this show. If you watch more than 3 episodes such a low Star rating doesn't make sense. Anyway, I hope FBI gets back to the S1 caliber of writing and acting. After that "Most Wanted" episode in S1 I saw a giant Red Flag. "Little Egypt" S2's first episode was another flag. Hopefully they continue for the better. Maggie and OA got me interested in FBI from the start. The acting chemistry is there. Now give them the surrounding plots and characters that made S1 so good CBS. programme.title: FBI
FBI
FBI: Special Crime Unit
programme.sub-title: S3 E11 S3 E11 Geschwisterbande
programme.desc: FBI: Created by Craig Turk, Dick Wolf. With Missy Peregrym, Zeeko Zaki, Jeremy Sisto, Alana De La Garza. Procedural drama about the inner workings of the New York office of the FBI, bringing to bear all the Bureau's skills, intellect and mind-blowing technology to keep New York and the country safe." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt7491982/","name":"FBI","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTg5Mjg5NDk4OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjY1ODIyNjM@._V1_.jpg","description":"Procedural drama about the inner workings of the New York office of the FBI, bringing to bear all the Bureau's skills, intellect and mind-blowing technology to keep New York and the country safe.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt7491982/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"blueoysterdvp"},"dateCreated":"2020-01-22","inLanguage":"English","name":"A Tale Of Two Seasons","reviewBody":"Some viewers leaving comments here appear to be watching Season 2 only. If you have CBS All Access that can be understandable since they DON'T carry S1. For $10 bucks a month it should be available. Just watching S2 can get confusing if you haven't seen the much better Season One minus the "Most Wanted" episode. That episode was the Pilot for "FBI: Most Wanted" and not very good. The First Season of FBI was more suspenseful with better writing and plots. The same could be said for the characters. Where's Ian Lim been lately played by James Chen? A much better character than what looks like his replacement Kelly Moran played by Taylor Anthony Miller. Not a good replacement so far. Hopefully Chen comes back. A big loss for the show. Sela Ward as Dana Mosier was leaving after Season One no matter what. A huge loss. Her replacement Alana De La Garza as Isobel Castile has been a hit or miss affair. Horrible in S2 E1 "Little Egypt", better in every show after. Still no Dana though. John Boyd as Stuart Scola has been bringing S2 down. Why his "Barney Fife" character hasn't been written off the show is a better mystery than some of the S2 plots. His new partner Emily Ryder played by Catherine Haena Kim has been solid so far. She has a future in acting. Why Kristen Chazel (Ebonee Noel) was taken out of the field as Scola's partner is baffling. Maybe due to the absence of Iam at headquarters? S2 is not S1 yet. It's not bad either, though uneven. Viewers that don't watch or like FBI are going to give those One Star ratings that don't make sense. If it's a bonafide 1 Star show it would've been yanked off the air after 5 shows. For those folks, don't watch this show. If you watch more than 3 episodes such a low Star rating doesn't make sense. Anyway, I hope FBI gets back to the S1 caliber of writing and acting. After that "Most Wanted" episode in S1 I saw a giant Red Flag. "Little Egypt" S2's first episode was another flag. Hopefully they continue for the better. Maggie and OA got me interested in FBI from the start. The acting chemistry is there. Now give them the surrounding plots and characters that made S1 so good CBS. Put S1 on All Access too while you're at it!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":14311,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.9},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2018-09-25","keywords":"violence,police investigation,copaganda,fbi agent,fbi federal bureau of investigation","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1335291/","name":"Missy Peregrym"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4976368/","name":"Zeeko Zaki"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005438/","name":"Jeremy Sisto"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0019598/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0274041/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0046592/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1541762/","name":"Craig Turk"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0937725/","name":"Dick Wolf"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"First Look Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi251968281","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWM2YTdkNmItYzNhOC00MjBmLWExMDEtZmNmZWZhMTRjNjgwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWM2YTdkNmItYzNhOC00MjBmLWExMDEtZmNmZWZhMTRjNjgwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg","description":""}}</script><metacontent="

programme.review: IMDb data; ttnr: 7491982, Title: FBI, --- Description: FBI: Created by Craig Turk, Dick Wolf. With Missy Peregrym, Zeeko Zaki, Jeremy Sisto, Alana De La Garza. Procedural drama about the inner workings of the New York office of the FBI, bringing to bear all the Bureau's skills, intellect and mind-blowing technology to keep New York and the country safe." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt7491982/","name":"FBI","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTg5Mjg5NDk4OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjY1ODIyNjM@._V1_.jpg","description":"Procedural drama about the inner workings of the New York office of the FBI, bringing to bear all the Bureau's skills, intellect and mind-blowing technology to keep New York and the country safe.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt7491982/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"blueoysterdvp","dateCreated":"2020-01-22","inLanguage":"English","name":"A Tale Of Two Seasons","reviewBody":"Some viewers leaving comments here appear to be watching Season 2 only. If you have CBS All Access that can be understandable since they DON'T carry S1. For $10 bucks a month it should be available. Just watching S2 can get confusing if you haven't seen the much better Season One minus the "Most Wanted" episode. That episode was the Pilot for "FBI: Most Wanted" and not very good. The First Season of FBI was more suspenseful with better writing and plots. The same could be said for the characters. Where's Ian Lim been lately played by James Chen? A much better character than what looks like his replacement Kelly Moran played by Taylor Anthony Miller. Not a good replacement so far. Hopefully Chen comes back. A big loss for the show. Sela Ward as Dana Mosier was leaving after Season One no matter what. A huge loss. Her replacement Alana De La Garza as Isobel Castile has been a hit or miss affair. Horrible in S2 E1 "Little Egypt", better in every show after. Still no Dana though. John Boyd as Stuart Scola has been bringing S2 down. Why his "Barney Fife" character hasn't been written off the show is a better mystery than some of the S2 plots. His new partner Emily Ryder played by Catherine Haena Kim has been solid so far. She has a future in acting. Why Kristen Chazel (Ebonee Noel) was taken out of the field as Scola's partner is baffling. Maybe due to the absence of Iam at headquarters? S2 is not S1 yet. It's not bad either, though uneven. Viewers that don't watch or like FBI are going to give those One Star ratings that don't make sense. If it's a bonafide 1 Star show it would've been yanked off the air after 5 shows. For those folks, don't watch this show. If you watch more than 3 episodes such a low Star rating doesn't make sense. Anyway, I hope FBI gets back to the S1 caliber of writing and acting. After that "Most Wanted" episode in S1 I saw a giant Red Flag. "Little Egypt" S2's first episode was another flag. Hopefully they continue for the better. Maggie and OA got me interested in FBI from the start. The acting chemistry is there. Now give them the surrounding plots and characters that made S1 so good CBS. Put S1 on All Access too while you're at it!","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":14311,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.9,"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2018-09-25","keywords":"violence,police investigation,copaganda,fbi agent,fbi federal bureau of investigation","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1335291/","name":"Missy Peregrym","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4976368/","name":"Zeeko Zaki","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005438/","name":"Jeremy Sisto"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0019598/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0274041/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0046592/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1541762/","name":"Craig Turk","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0937725/","name":"Dick Wolf"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"First Look Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi251968281","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWM2YTdkNmItYzNhOC00MjBmLWExMDEtZmNmZWZhMTRjNjgwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWM2YTdkNmItYzNhOC00MjBmLWExMDEtZmNmZWZhMTRjNjgwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg","description":""</script><metacontent="

programme.review: IMDb data; ttnr: 0364845, Title: NCIS: Naval Criminal Investigative Service, --- Description: NCIS: Naval Criminal Investigative Service: Created by Donald P. Bellisario, Don McGill. With Mark Harmon, David McCallum, Sean Murray, Pauley Perrette. The cases of the Naval Criminal Investigative Service's Washington, D.C. Major Case Response Team, led by Special Agent Leroy Jethro Gibbs." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt0364845/","name":"NCIS: Naval Criminal Investigative Service","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjVlMjZhYzYtOGQxNC00OTQxLTk2NzEtMWFmMmNhODA4YjYzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjQ3MDgwNjY@._V1_.jpg","description":"The cases of the Naval Criminal Investigative Service's Washington, D.C. Major Case Response Team, led by Special Agent Leroy Jethro Gibbs.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0364845/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"shellemk","dateCreated":"2004-09-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"Time flies when you're enjoying yourself","reviewBody":"and each episode speeds along all too quickly! I LOVE this show ! What is there NOT to like? Rich story lines, strongly portrayed (and very human) personalities you can really warm to who play off each other brilliantly, all with their own distinctive quirks and  above all  the always wonderful Mark Harmon as main character! What more could you ask for in a show?! There's not a single character I'd change  none that irritate  they're all excellent. I consider it a bonus that it's the one thing on TV that all our family equally enjoy for different reasons. Major Case Response Team, led by Special Agent Leroy Jethro Gibbs." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt0364845/","name":"NCIS: Naval Criminal Investigative Service","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjVlMjZhYzYtOGQxNC00OTQxLTk2NzEtMWFmMmNhODA4YjYzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjQ3MDgwNjY@._V1_.jpg","description":"The cases of the Naval Criminal Investigative Service's Washington, D.C. Major Case Response Team, led by Special Agent Leroy Jethro Gibbs.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0364845/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"shellemk","dateCreated":"2004-09-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"Time flies when you're enjoying yourself","reviewBody":"and each episode speeds along all too quickly! I LOVE this show ! What is there NOT to like? Rich story lines, strongly portrayed (and very human) personalities you can really warm to who play off each other brilliantly, all with their own distinctive quirks and  above all  the always wonderful Mark Harmon as main character! What more could you ask for in a show?! There's not a single character I'd change  none that irritate  they're all excellent. I consider it a bonus that it's the one thing on TV that all our family equally enjoy for different reasons. Even my father-in-law likes this and we normally have totally different viewing preferences! I was delighted when I heard that there was a second series imminent. Only problem is that living in England, who knows how long after it's shown in the US we'll get to see it! Major Case Response Team, led by Special Agent Leroy Jethro Gibbs." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt0364845/","name":"NCIS: Naval Criminal Investigative Service","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjVlMjZhYzYtOGQxNC00OTQxLTk2NzEtMWFmMmNhODA4YjYzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjQ3MDgwNjY@._V1_.jpg","description":"The cases of the Naval Criminal Investigative Service's Washington, D.C. Major Case Response Team, led by Special Agent Leroy Jethro Gibbs.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0364845/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"shellemk","dateCreated":"2004-09-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"Time flies when you're enjoying yourself","reviewBody":"and each episode speeds along all too quickly! I LOVE this show ! What is there NOT to like? Rich story lines, strongly portrayed (and very human) personalities you can really warm to who play off each other brilliantly, all with their own distinctive quirks and  above all  the always wonderful Mark Harmon as main character! What more could you ask for in a show?! There's not a single character I'd change  none that irritate  they're all excellent. I consider it a bonus that it's the one thing on TV that all our family equally enjoy for different reasons. Even my father-in-law likes this and we normally have totally different viewing preferences! I was delighted when I heard that there was a second series imminent. Only problem is that living in England, who knows how long after it's shown in the US we'll get to see it! Fortunately it's worth the wait!","aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":134442,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.7,"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2003-09-23","keywords":"goth girl,babe scientist,special agent,naval criminal investigative service,police procedural","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001319/","name":"Mark Harmon","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0564724/","name":"David McCallum","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0615266/","name":"Sean Murray"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0114905/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0066107/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0183875/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0069074/","name":"Donald P. Major Case Response Team, led by Special Agent Leroy Jethro Gibbs.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0364845/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"shellemk","dateCreated":"2004-09-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"Time flies when you're enjoying yourself","reviewBody":"and each episode speeds along all too quickly! I LOVE this show ! What is there NOT to like? Rich story lines, strongly portrayed (and very human) personalities you can really warm to who play off each other brilliantly, all with their own distinctive quirks and  above all  the always wonderful Mark Harmon as main character! What more could you ask for in a show?! There's not a single character I'd change  none that irritate  they're all excellent. I consider it a bonus that it's the one thing on TV that all our family equally enjoy for different reasons. Even my father-in-law likes this and we normally have totally different viewing preferences! I was delighted when I heard that there was a second series imminent. Only problem is that living in England, who knows how long after it's shown in the US we'll get to see it! Major Case Response Team, led by Special Agent Leroy Jethro Gibbs." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt0364845/","name":"NCIS: Naval Criminal Investigative Service","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjVlMjZhYzYtOGQxNC00OTQxLTk2NzEtMWFmMmNhODA4YjYzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjQ3MDgwNjY@._V1_.jpg","description":"The cases of the Naval Criminal Investigative Service's Washington, D.C. Major Case Response Team, led by Special Agent Leroy Jethro Gibbs.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0364845/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"shellemk","dateCreated":"2004-09-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"Time flies when you're enjoying yourself","reviewBody":"and each episode speeds along all too quickly! I LOVE this show ! What is there NOT to like? Rich story lines, strongly portrayed (and very human) personalities you can really warm to who play off each other brilliantly, all with their own distinctive quirks and  above all  the always wonderful Mark Harmon as main character! What more could you ask for in a show?! There's not a single character I'd change  none that irritate  they're all excellent. I consider it a bonus that it's the one thing on TV that all our family equally enjoy for different reasons. Even my father-in-law likes this and we normally have totally different viewing preferences! I was delighted when I heard that there was a second series imminent. Only problem is that living in England, who knows how long after it's shown in the US we'll get to see it! I LOVE this show ! What is there NOT to like? Rich story lines, strongly portrayed (and very human) personalities you can really warm to who play off each other brilliantly, all with their own distinctive quirks and  above all  the always wonderful Mark Harmon as main character! What more could you ask for in a show?! There's not a single character I'd change  none that irritate  they're all excellent. I consider it a bonus that it's the one thing on TV that all our family equally enjoy for different reasons. Even my father-in-law likes this and we normally have totally different viewing preferences! I was delighted when I heard that there was a second series imminent. Only problem is that living in England, who knows how long after it's shown in the US we'll get to see it! programme.review: IMDb data; ttnr: 0364845, Title: NCIS: Naval Criminal Investigative Service, --- Description: NCIS: Naval Criminal Investigative Service: Created by Donald P. Bellisario, Don McGill. With Mark Harmon, David McCallum, Sean Murray, Pauley Perrette. The cases of the Naval Criminal Investigative Service's Washington, D.C. Major Case Response Team, led by Special Agent Leroy Jethro Gibbs." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt0364845/","name":"NCIS: Naval Criminal Investigative Service","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjVlMjZhYzYtOGQxNC00OTQxLTk2NzEtMWFmMmNhODA4YjYzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjQ3MDgwNjY@._V1_.jpg","description":"The cases of the Naval Criminal Investigative Service's Washington, D.C. Major Case Response Team, led by Special Agent Leroy Jethro Gibbs.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0364845/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"shellemk","dateCreated":"2004-09-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"Time flies when you're enjoying yourself","reviewBody":"and each episode speeds along all too quickly! I LOVE this show ! What is there NOT to like? Rich story lines, strongly portrayed (and very human) personalities you can really warm to who play off each other brilliantly, all with their own distinctive quirks and  above all  the always wonderful Mark Harmon as main character! What more could you ask for in a show?! There's not a single character I'd change  none that irritate  they're all excellent. I consider it a bonus that it's the one thing on TV that all our family equally enjoy for different reasons. Even my father-in-law likes this and we normally have totally different viewing preferences! I was delighted when I heard that there was a second series imminent. Only problem is that living in England, who knows how long after it's shown in the US we'll get to see it! Fortunately it's worth the wait!","aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":134442,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.7,"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2003-09-23","keywords":"goth girl,babe scientist,special agent,naval criminal investigative service,police procedural","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001319/","name":"Mark Harmon","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0564724/","name":"David McCallum","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0615266/","name":"Sean Murray"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0114905/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0066107/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0183875/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0069074/","name":"Donald P. programme.sub-title: S3 E12 S3 E12 Väter und Söhne
programme.desc: FBI: Created by Craig Turk, Dick Wolf. With Missy Peregrym, Zeeko Zaki, Jeremy Sisto, Alana De La Garza. Procedural drama about the inner workings of the New York office of the FBI, bringing to bear all the Bureau's skills, intellect and mind-blowing technology to keep New York and the country safe." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt7491982/","name":"FBI","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTg5Mjg5NDk4OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjY1ODIyNjM@._V1_.jpg","description":"Procedural drama about the inner workings of the New York office of the FBI, bringing to bear all the Bureau's skills, intellect and mind-blowing technology to keep New York and the country safe.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt7491982/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"blueoysterdvp"},"dateCreated":"2020-01-22","inLanguage":"English","name":"A Tale Of Two Seasons","reviewBody":"Some viewers leaving comments here appear to be watching Season 2 only. If you have CBS All Access that can be understandable since they DON'T carry S1. For $10 bucks a month it should be available. Just watching S2 can get confusing if you haven't seen the much better Season One minus the "Most Wanted" episode. That episode was the Pilot for "FBI: Most Wanted" and not very good. The First Season of FBI was more suspenseful with better writing and plots. The same could be said for the characters. Where's Ian Lim been lately played by James Chen? A much better character than what looks like his replacement Kelly Moran played by Taylor Anthony Miller. Not a good replacement so far. Hopefully Chen comes back. A big loss for the show. Sela Ward as Dana Mosier was leaving after Season One no matter what. A huge loss. Her replacement Alana De La Garza as Isobel Castile has been a hit or miss affair. Horrible in S2 E1 "Little Egypt", better in every show after. Still no Dana though. John Boyd as Stuart Scola has been bringing S2 down. Why his "Barney Fife" character hasn't been written off the show is a better mystery than some of the S2 plots. His new partner Emily Ryder played by Catherine Haena Kim has been solid so far. She has a future in acting. Why Kristen Chazel (Ebonee Noel) was taken out of the field as Scola's partner is baffling. Maybe due to the absence of Iam at headquarters? S2 is not S1 yet. It's not bad either, though uneven. Viewers that don't watch or like FBI are going to give those One Star ratings that don't make sense. If it's a bonafide 1 Star show it would've been yanked off the air after 5 shows. For those folks, don't watch this show. If you watch more than 3 episodes such a low Star rating doesn't make sense. Anyway, I hope FBI gets back to the S1 caliber of writing and acting. After that "Most Wanted" episode in S1 I saw a giant Red Flag. "Little Egypt" S2's first episode was another flag. Hopefully they continue for the better. Maggie and OA got me interested in FBI from the start. The acting chemistry is there. Now give them the surrounding plots and characters that made S1 so good CBS. Put S1 on All Access too while you're at it!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":14311,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.9},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2018-09-25","keywords":"violence,police investigation,copaganda,fbi agent,fbi federal bureau of investigation","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1335291/","name":"Missy Peregrym"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4976368/","name":"Zeeko Zaki"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005438/","name":"Jeremy Sisto"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0019598/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0274041/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0046592/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1541762/","name":"Craig Turk"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0937725/","name":"Dick Wolf"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"First Look Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi251968281","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWM2YTdkNmItYzNhOC00MjBmLWExMDEtZmNmZWZhMTRjNjgwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWM2YTdkNmItYzNhOC00MjBmLWExMDEtZmNmZWZhMTRjNjgwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg","description":""}}</script><metacontent="

programme.category: Action, Crime, Drama, Action, Crime, Drama, Mystery, Thriller
programme.review: IMDb data; ttnr: 7491982, Title: FBI, --- Description: FBI: Created by Craig Turk, Dick Wolf. With Missy Peregrym, Zeeko Zaki, Jeremy Sisto, Alana De La Garza. Procedural drama about the inner workings of the New York office of the FBI, bringing to bear all the Bureau's skills, intellect and mind-blowing technology to keep New York and the country safe." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt7491982/","name":"FBI","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTg5Mjg5NDk4OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjY1ODIyNjM@._V1_.jpg","description":"Procedural drama about the inner workings of the New York office of the FBI, bringing to bear all the Bureau's skills, intellect and mind-blowing technology to keep New York and the country safe.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt7491982/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"blueoysterdvp","dateCreated":"2020-01-22","inLanguage":"English","name":"A Tale Of Two Seasons","reviewBody":"Some viewers leaving comments here appear to be watching Season 2 only. If you have CBS All Access that can be understandable since they DON'T carry S1. For $10 bucks a month it should be available. Just watching S2 can get confusing if you haven't seen the much better Season One minus the "Most Wanted" episode. That episode was the Pilot for "FBI: Most Wanted" and not very good. The First Season of FBI was more suspenseful with better writing and plots. The same could be said for the characters. Where's Ian Lim been lately played by James Chen? A much better character than what looks like his replacement Kelly Moran played by Taylor Anthony Miller. Not a good replacement so far. Hopefully Chen comes back. A big loss for the show. Sela Ward as Dana Mosier was leaving after Season One no matter what. A huge loss. Her replacement Alana De La Garza as Isobel Castile has been a hit or miss affair. Horrible in S2 E1 "Little Egypt", better in every show after. Still no Dana though. John Boyd as Stuart Scola has been bringing S2 down. Why his "Barney Fife" character hasn't been written off the show is a better mystery than some of the S2 plots. His new partner Emily Ryder played by Catherine Haena Kim has been solid so far. She has a future in acting. Why Kristen Chazel (Ebonee Noel) was taken out of the field as Scola's partner is baffling. Maybe due to the absence of Iam at headquarters? S2 is not S1 yet. It's not bad either, though uneven. Viewers that don't watch or like FBI are going to give those One Star ratings that don't make sense. If it's a bonafide 1 Star show it would've been yanked off the air after 5 shows. For those folks, don't watch this show. If you watch more than 3 episodes such a low Star rating doesn't make sense. Anyway, I hope FBI gets back to the S1 caliber of writing and acting. After that "Most Wanted" episode in S1 I saw a giant Red Flag. "Little Egypt" S2's first episode was another flag. Hopefully they continue for the better. Maggie and OA got me interested in FBI from the start. The acting chemistry is there. Now give them the surrounding plots and characters that made S1 so good CBS. Put S1 on All Access too while you're at it!","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":14311,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.9,"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2018-09-25","keywords":"violence,police investigation,copaganda,fbi agent,fbi federal bureau of investigation","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1335291/","name":"Missy Peregrym","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4976368/","name":"Zeeko Zaki","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005438/","name":"Jeremy Sisto"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0019598/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0274041/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0046592/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1541762/","name":"Craig Turk","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0937725/","name":"Dick Wolf"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"First Look Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi251968281","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWM2YTdkNmItYzNhOC00MjBmLWExMDEtZmNmZWZhMTRjNjgwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWM2YTdkNmItYzNhOC00MjBmLWExMDEtZmNmZWZhMTRjNjgwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg","description":""</script><metacontent="

Procedural drama about the inner workings of the New York office of the FBI, bringing to bear all the Bureau's skills, intellect and mind-blowing technology to keep New York and the country safe." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt7491982/","name":"FBI","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTg5Mjg5NDk4OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjY1ODIyNjM@._V1_.jpg","description":"Procedural drama about the inner workings of the New York office of the FBI, bringing to bear all the Bureau's skills, intellect and mind-blowing technology to keep New York and the country safe.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt7491982/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"blueoysterdvp","dateCreated":"2020-01-22","inLanguage":"English","name":"A Tale Of Two Seasons","reviewBody":"Some viewers leaving comments here appear to be watching Season 2 only. If you have CBS All Access that can be understandable since they DON'T carry S1. For $10 bucks a month it should be available. Just watching S2 can get confusing if you haven't seen the much better Season One minus the "Most Wanted" episode. That episode was the Pilot for "FBI: Most Wanted" and not very good. The First Season of FBI was more suspenseful with better writing and plots. The same could be said for the characters. Where's Ian Lim been lately played by James Chen? A much better character than what looks like his replacement Kelly Moran played by Taylor Anthony Miller. Not a good replacement so far. Hopefully Chen comes back. A big loss for the show. Sela Ward as Dana Mosier was leaving after Season One no matter what. A huge loss. Her replacement Alana De La Garza as Isobel Castile has been a hit or miss affair. Horrible in S2 E1 "Little Egypt", better in every show after. Still no Dana though. John Boyd as Stuart Scola has been bringing S2 down. Why his "Barney Fife" character hasn't been written off the show is a better mystery than some of the S2 plots. His new partner Emily Ryder played by Catherine Haena Kim has been solid so far. She has a future in acting. Why Kristen Chazel (Ebonee Noel) was taken out of the field as Scola's partner is baffling. Maybe due to the absence of Iam at headquarters? S2 is not S1 yet. It's not bad either, though uneven. Viewers that don't watch or like FBI are going to give those One Star ratings that don't make sense. If it's a bonafide 1 Star show it would've been yanked off the air after 5 shows. For those folks, don't watch this show. If you watch more than 3 episodes such a low Star rating doesn't make sense. Anyway, I hope FBI gets back to the S1 caliber of writing and acting. After that "Most Wanted" episode in S1 I saw a giant Red Flag. "Little Egypt" S2's first episode was another flag. Hopefully they continue for the better. Maggie and OA got me interested in FBI from the start. The acting chemistry is there. Now give them the surrounding plots and characters that made S1 so good CBS. Put S1 on All Access too while you're at it!","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":14311,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.9,"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2018-09-25","keywords":"violence,police investigation,copaganda,fbi agent,fbi federal bureau of investigation","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1335291/","name":"Missy Peregrym","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4976368/","name":"Zeeko Zaki","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005438/","name":"Jeremy Sisto"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0019598/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0274041/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0046592/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1541762/","name":"Craig Turk","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0937725/","name":"Dick Wolf"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"First Look Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi251968281","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWM2YTdkNmItYzNhOC00MjBmLWExMDEtZmNmZWZhMTRjNjgwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWM2YTdkNmItYzNhOC00MjBmLWExMDEtZmNmZWZhMTRjNjgwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg","description":""</script><metacontent="

Major Case Response Team, led by Special Agent Leroy Jethro Gibbs.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0364845/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"shellemk","dateCreated":"2004-09-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"Time flies when you're enjoying yourself","reviewBody":"and each episode speeds along all too quickly! I LOVE this show ! What is there NOT to like? Rich story lines, strongly portrayed (and very human) personalities you can really warm to who play off each other brilliantly, all with their own distinctive quirks and  above all  the always wonderful Mark Harmon as main character! What more could you ask for in a show?! There's not a single character I'd change  none that irritate  they're all excellent. I consider it a bonus that it's the one thing on TV that all our family equally enjoy for different reasons. Even my father-in-law likes this and we normally have totally different viewing preferences! I was delighted when I heard that there was a second series imminent. Only problem is that living in England, who knows how long after it's shown in the US we'll get to see it! Fortunately it's worth the wait!","aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":134442,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.7,"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2003-09-23","keywords":"goth girl,babe scientist,special agent,naval criminal investigative service,police procedural","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001319/","name":"Mark Harmon","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0564724/","name":"David McCallum","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0615266/","name":"Sean Murray"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0114905/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0066107/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0183875/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0069074/","name":"Donald P. programme.title: Le plus beau métier du monde
programme.desc: Laurent Monier, professeur d'histoire-géographie dans un collège d'Annecy, aime beaucoup les femmes. Un jour, son épouse Hélène découvre qu'il la trompe. Elle le quitte sur-le-champ, obtient le divorce et part s'installer à Paris. Pour se rapprocher de ses deux enfants, Laurent demande alors sa mutation. Le rectorat lui confie une classe de quatrième technologique dans un établissement sensible de banlieue. Les débuts du professeur dans ce nouvel environnement sont difficiles.

programme.title: Lou ! Journal infime
programme.desc: La petite Lou vit en parfaite harmonie avec sa mère, une jeune femme divorcée. Leur existence un peu bohème est rythmée par leur complicité, par l'amitié que Lou voue à sa meilleure copine Mina, d'un milieu assez différent. Elle espionne aussi régulièrement son voisin Tristan, dont elle est un peu amoureuse. Un petit chat gris change un peu leur quotidien. Mais leur vie est vraiment bousculée avec l'arrivée de Richard, leur nouveau voisin. Lou aimerait beaucoup que sa maman refasse sa vie avec lui.

programme.title: En équilibre
programme.desc: Après un grave accident sur un tournage, Marc Guermont, cascadeur équestre pour le cinéma, est en convalescence, soutenu par sa famille, dans sa maison en Bretagne. L'homme, qui sait qu'il ne pourra plus exercer son métier, reçoit la visite de Florence Kernel, agente de sa compagnie d'assurances, chargée de trouver un arrangement avec lui. Alors que la jeune femme est pressée par sa direction de régler l'affaire, Marc refuse un compromis qu'il juge en sa défaveur.

programme.title: Caractères
programme.desc: Chaque mois Cyrille Eldin évoque la littérature autour d'un thème central. L'animateur s'intéresse à tous les genres, des livres pratiques en passant par les grands classiques, les ouvrages sur le développement personnel sans oublier les best-sellers du moment et la bande-dessinée. Plusieurs séquences animent ce rendez-vous vespéral littéraire : interviews, performances créatives, ou encore les recommandations de "booktubeurs".

programme.title: Magistral.e
programme.sub-title: Michel Hazanavicius

programme.title: Après le mariage
programme.desc: Isabel Anderson, directrice d’un orphelinat en Inde en manque de ressources, est obligée de se rendre à New York afin de rencontrer Theresa Young, une riche femme d’affaires susceptible de faire un don à son institution de deux millions de dollars. Mais le jour de leur entrevue, Theresa Young semble bien plus préoccupée par la vente de sa compagnie et les derniers préparatifs du mariage de sa fille que par l'exposition des projets à venir de l'organisation caritative. Elle insiste même pour qu'Isabel assiste à la célébration, qui se déroule le lendemain.

programme.title: Le cercle
programme.desc: "Le Cercle" est un magazine de débats et de critiques cinéphiles animé par un journaliste en compagnie de chroniqueurs et en présence d'un public d'étudiants en cinéma.

programme.title: City of Lies
programme.desc: Le 18 mars 1997, à Hollywood, en Californie, Christopher George Lator Wallace, plus connu sous son nom d’artiste The Notorious B.I.G., est enterré dans une ambiance électrique. Neuf jours plus tôt, le rappeur, également connu sous le pseudonyme de Biggie Smalls, était assassiné dans la même ville par arme à feu. Dix-huit ans plus tard, Russell Poole, le policier qui fut chargé d'enquêter sur le meurtre, cherche toujours à clore cette affaire, non résolue. Il est alors contacté par Darius «Jack» Jackson, un journaliste qui veut lui aussi faire éclater la vérité sur le meurtre.

programme.title: Battleship Island
programme.desc: En novembre 1944, l'île japonaise d'Hashima abrite une importante mine dans laquelle des prisonniers coréens sont forcés de travailler dans des conditions épouvantables, souvent au péril de leur vie. En avril 1945, Lee Kang-ok, musicien de jazz et chef d'orchestre pour un hôtel de Séoul, décide de se rendre au Japon avec certains de ses musiciens et sa fille pour mettre ses proches en sûreté. Après une rude traversée en mer avec d'autres coréens dans la même situation, Kang-ok comprend qu'ils sont été piégés. La plupart sont beintôt emmenés de force vers Hashima.

programme.title: Les traducteurs
programme.desc: L 'éditeur Eric Angstrom annonce la parution simultanée dans neuf langues du dernier volet de "Dédalus", un best-seller mondial. Les traducteurs se rendent dans un manoir où ils travaillent sous haute-surveillance. Certains sont ravis, comme la russe Katerina, sosie du personnage principal. A la différence du grec Konstantinos qui voit ce livre comme un symbole du capitalisme. Les dix premières pages du roman sont finalement divulguées sur internet. Le pirate demande une rançon pour ne pas publier le reste. Selon l'éditeur, la fuite ne peut venir que des traducteurs.

programme.title: Bad Boys for Life
programme.desc: Les rues de Miami sont agitées car Marcus et son collègue Mike roulent à une vitesse démesurée afin de se rendre à la clinique où Megan, la fille de Marcus, vient de donner naissance à son premier enfant. Pendant ce temps, Isabel Aretas, une criminelle, s'évade violemment d'une prison mexicaine et retrouve son fils Armando, à qui elle fait promettre de venger son père. Le jeune homme se rend immédiatement à Miami et commence une croisade sanglante, dont l'une des cibles n'est autre que Mike.

programme.title: Opérations spéciales
programme.sub-title: Shorta

programme.title: Shorta
programme.desc: Après l'arrestation brutale de Talib Ben Hassi, 19 ans, dans le quartier sensible de Svalegarden, le jeune homme se retrouve en soins intensifs. Alors que la tension s'aggrave dans la cité, tous les policiers disponibles sont mobilisés pour surveiller les lieux. Parmi eux, Jens Hoyer, calme et pondéré, est chargé de faire équipe avec Mike Andersen, au discours et au comportement parfois excessifs. Au cours de leur tournée, Jens remarque une voiture suspecte. Les deux policiers la suivent tout droit jusqu'à Svalegarden. Ils y sont bientôt rejoints par une équipe de journalistes télé.

programme.title: The Last Son
programme.desc: Isaac Lemay a longtemps parcouru les plaines de l'Ouest, et ses nuits passées avec des prostituées ont laissé des enfants dont il ne s'est jamais occupé. Mais l'homme, qui a commis des massacres de cheyennes pour le compte de l'armée, fut la cible d'une malédiction lancée par le grand chef White Thunder : un de ses enfants viendrait un jour pour le tuer. Afin d'éviter ce funeste sort, Lemay s'est lancé à la recherche de tous ses enfants, les tuant un par un afin d'éviter le funeste sort qui lui a été promis. Connu pour son pistolet à crosse d'ivoire, l'homme était fui comme la peste par ceux qui l'avaient identifié.

programme.title: Dirty Cops
programme.desc: Alicia West est revenue depuis peu de temps à la Nouvelle Orléans. Alors qu'elle fait son jogging, la jeune femme, noire, est interpellée brutalement par deux policiers. Seulement, Alicia est également officier de police et le leur fait savoir. Quelques heures plus tard, elle fait sa tournée avec son partenaire Kevin Jennings dans le quartier désormais mal famé de Kingston, où elle a passé son enfance. Elle y croise une amie d'enfance, Missy, désormais liée à une bande de criminels qui sévit dans le quartier. Le soir-même, elle suit Deacon Brown pour sa patrouille de nuit.

programme.title: Profession : photographe
programme.desc: Antoine de Caunes fait croiser les regards des différents représentants d'une même discipline. Il donne la parole aux photographes de presse, de mode et aux correspondants de guerre. Véronique de Viguerie, Patrick Chauvel, Karim Sadli, Charlotte Abramow, Jane Evelyn Atwood et Paolo Roversi échangent sur leur passion devenu leur métier et partagent leur point de vue.

programme.title: Brice de Nice
programme.desc: Eternel adolescent âgé de presque 30 ans, Brice a une idole : Bodhi, le personnage joué par Patrick Swayze dans le film Point Break. Il ne vit qu'à travers lui, guettant en vain la vague parfaite dans la baie de Nice. Passant d'une fête à l'autre, il est passé maître dans l'art de se moquer de tous ceux qu'il croise. Mais le jour où son père, homme d'affaires, est incarcéré, il doit faire face aux réalités.

programme.title: Seize printemps
programme.desc: Suzanne a 16 ans, elle vit à Paris, rive gauche, auprès de Marie, sa soeur aînée, et de leurs parents aimants. L'adolescente, qui préfère nettement le diabolo grenadine à la bière, se sent un en décalage avec ses camarades de lycée et plus généralement avec les jeunes gens de son âge. Sur son trajet quotidien, elle croise le regard et attire bientôt l'attention de Raphaël, un comédien de théâtre de 35 ans. De petits déjeuners en cafés et en sorties nocturnes, Raphaël et Suzanne se rapprochent peu à peu.

programme.title: Confidences trop intimes
programme.desc: Parce qu'elle s'est trompée de porte, Anna Delambre s'est retrouvée à confier ses déboires conjugaux à William Faber, conseiller fiscal. Touché par sa détresse, il n'a pas eu le courage de lui dire qu'il n'était pas psychanalyste. De rendez-vous en rendez-vous, un étrange rituel s'instaure entre eux. William est à chaque fois ému par la jeune femme et fasciné d'entendre ce que personne ne livre jamais. Qui est donc Anna ? Est-elle seulement dupe du jeu qui se joue ? Chaque jour plus impliqués dans cette relation, Anna et William commencent à remettre en cause leur vie, leurs proches.

programme.title: Fin des programmes
programme.desc: Nos programmes se terminent pour cette journée, en attendant ceux de demain.

programme.title: Magistral.e
programme.sub-title: Riad Sattouf

programme.title: Le mariage de Rosa
programme.desc: Rosa, 45 ans, n'a pas une seconde à elle. Costumière pour le cinéma, elle est régulièrement sollicitée plus que de raison par les réalisateurs pour lesquels elle travaille. Son frère Armando, sur le point de divorcer, lui confie régulièrement ses problèmes tandis que ses amis et voisins comptent sur elle pour garder un chat ou arroser des plantes. Mais Rosa s'inquiète également pour sa fille Lidia, mariée et mère de deux enfants. La jeune femme est débordée par la garde des bambins depuis que son mari l'a quittée et Rosa s'inquiète de la voir s'isoler de son entourage.

programme.title: Avance (trop) rapide
programme.desc: Au cours d'une soirée de nouvel an, Teddy rencontre Leanne et si le coup de foudre est immédiat, le couple se forme quelque temps plus tard. A tel point que Teddy, accompagné de Leanne, s'en excuse auprès de ses parents, enterrés dans le même cimetière avant d'avoir pu rencontrer la jeune femme. C'est là qu'il est abordé par une étrange femme, qui le presse de concrétiser ses projets importants avant que le temps passe. Après cette conversation bizarre, Teddy se décide et demande Leanne en mariage. Mais quelques heures après la cérémonie, Teddy constate que le temps défile à une vitesse inquiétante.

programme.title: La vengeance au triple galop
programme.desc: Après le décès de son père, Tod Douglas, Stéphanie hérite de son empire industriel. Elle redouble d'efforts pour s'imposer dans un monde quelle connait mal. Les années passent et la jeune femme succombe au charme de Craig Danners, sportif célèbre et admiré. Elle est loin de se douter que Craig n'en veut qu'à son argent. Non content d'avoir une relation torride avec Crystal, la meilleure amie de son épouse, il profite d'une sortie à cheval pour provoquer un accident laissant Stéphanie pour morte au fond d'un ravin.

programme.title: L'amour flou
programme.desc: Après dix ans de vie commune et de bonheur, Romane et Philippe se séparent car ils ne supportent plus. Entre eux, l'amour a disparu depuis quelques temps pour faire place à un autre type de sentiment. Ils veulent se quitter et refaire leur vie, mais pas vraiment. Afin de toujours être à deux pas l'un de l'autre, Romane propose à Philippe de vivre dans deux appartements séparés mais reliés par la chambre de leurs deux enfants, Rose et Raoul. Un arrangement singulier qui laisse quelque peu dubitatifs à la fois les membres de leur famille et leurs proches.

programme.title: Mamie-sitter
programme.desc: Karin, retraitée sans enfants, s'ennuie un peu auprès de son mari Harald, passionné de trains miniatures et redoutablement casanier. Aussi, quand elle comprend qu'ils ne feront jamais le voyage en Nouvelle-Zélande qu'il lui avait promis, Karin suit l'exemple de Barbara, la dynamique soeur d'Harald, qui fut longtemps éducatrice et occupe désormais sa retraite en s'occupant d'un enfant quelques heures par semaine. Leur ami Gerhard, médecin, seul depuis la mort de son mari, vient d'enterrer leur chien et se retrouve dans la même situation de désarroi.

programme.title: Caractères
programme.desc: Chaque mois Cyrille Eldin évoque la littérature autour d'un thème central. L'animateur s'intéresse à tous les genres, des livres pratiques en passant par les grands classiques, les ouvrages sur le développement personnel sans oublier les best-sellers du moment et la bande-dessinée. Plusieurs séquences animent ce rendez-vous vespéral littéraire : interviews, performances créatives, ou encore les recommandations de "booktubeurs".

programme.title: Un dragon en forme de nuage
programme.desc: Vincenzo tient depuis quelques années une librairie sur une petite place de Montmartre. Sa vie est rythmée par les visites de Clemente, serveur d'un bistrot voisin, de Madame Milo, de ses clients réguliers et de Colombe, une infirmière, et de Gérard, un médecin, qui s'occupent de sa fille Albertine, mutique et coincée sur un fauteuil roulant. Cette existence trop bien réglée est un jour bouleversée par l'irruption de Yolande, visiblement paniquée, qui cherche son chien perdu. Bien accueillie par Vincenzo, la jeune femme, actrice de théâtre, va régulièrement revenir dans sa librairie.

programme.title: Après le mariage
programme.desc: Isabel Anderson, directrice d’un orphelinat en Inde en manque de ressources, est obligée de se rendre à New York afin de rencontrer Theresa Young, une riche femme d’affaires susceptible de faire un don à son institution de deux millions de dollars. Mais le jour de leur entrevue, Theresa Young semble bien plus préoccupée par la vente de sa compagnie et les derniers préparatifs du mariage de sa fille que par l'exposition des projets à venir de l'organisation caritative. Elle insiste même pour qu'Isabel assiste à la célébration, qui se déroule le lendemain.

programme.title: Peninsula
programme.desc: Quatre ans se sont déroulés depuis la catastrophe qui a d'abord frappé la Corée du Sud. Désormais, des zombies se sont répandus dans tous le pays, provocant des carnages. Dans ce contexte hautement dangereux, Jung-seok, capitaine dans la marine, parvient à embarquer avec lui sa soeur Min-jung, son mari Chul-min et leur fils Dong-hwan dans un navire à destination du japon. mais rapidement, Jung-seok apprend que le bateau doit être rerouté vers Hongkong. au même moment, les passagers constatent que l'un d'entre eux a été infecté.

programme.title: Groland le replait
programme.desc: Retrouvez les meilleurs moments des 7 Jours au Groland, et un résumé des dernières péripéties vécues par les habitants de la célèbre présipauté.

programme.title: Groland le replait
programme.desc: Retrouvez les meilleurs moments des 7 Jours au Groland, et un résumé des dernières péripéties vécues par les habitants de la célèbre présipauté.

programme.title: Barnie et ses petites contrariétés
programme.desc: Barnie vit à Calais avec Lucie, son épouse, mais à Londres, où il travaille, il a une jeune maîtresse et un amant, la jolie Margot et le séduisant Mark. Soucieux de protéger son couple, il règle chaque détail de son existence. Jusqu'au jour où Lucie, Margot et Mark décident chacun de son côté de l'emmener en voyage au même moment et au même endroit. Barnie envoie un mot d'excuse à ses deux amants, mais intervertit les lettres, entraînant leur courroux.

programme.title: Greenland, le dernier refuge
programme.desc: A Atlanta, en Géorgie, John Garrity, ingénieur structure, tente de sauver son mariage avec sa femme, Allison. Tous deux s'apprêtent à fêter avec leur fils Nathan, diabétique, et leurs voisins, le passage de Clarke, une comète interstellaire, baptisée Clarke, découverte quelques semaines plus tôt par la NASA. Mais tandis que l'heure de la fête approche, John est averti d'une menace imminente par la présidence des Etats-Unis. La comète est sur le point de frapper la Terre et John et sa famille doivent immédiatement se mettre à l'abri.

programme.title: Fin des programmes
programme.desc: Nos programmes se terminent pour cette journée, en attendant ceux de demain.

programme.title: Groland le replait
programme.desc: Retrouvez les meilleurs moments des 7 Jours au Groland, et un résumé des dernières péripéties vécues par les habitants de la célèbre présipauté.

programme.title: Redemption Day
programme.desc: Kate Paxton, une archéologue renommée, part au Maroc après la découverte sur place d'une ville souterraine. A peine arrivée sur le site de fouille, Kate est kidnappée par des terroristes, qui réclame une rançon exhorbitante. Quand son mari Brad, capitaine au sein de la Marine américaine et héros de guerre, apprend la nouvelle, il décide de se lancer dans une mission périlleuse pour sauver sa femme. Il va devoir affronter un ennemi dangereux mais aussi faire face à ses propres démons qui le hantent..

programme.title: Profession : sportif.ve
programme.desc: Antoine de Caunes réunit des sportifs de haut niveau qui viennent parler à mots choisis de leur passion devenue leur métier. La judokate Clarisse Agbégnénou, le pilote de Formule 1 Pierre Gasly, la boxeuse Estelle Mossely, le rugbyman Romain Ntamack, et la handballeuse Grâce Zaadi se livrent tour à tour au jeu de l'interview confidence.

programme.title: Caractères
programme.desc: Chaque mois Cyrille Eldin évoque la littérature autour d'un thème central. L'animateur s'intéresse à tous les genres, des livres pratiques en passant par les grands classiques, les ouvrages sur le développement personnel sans oublier les best-sellers du moment et la bande-dessinée. Plusieurs séquences animent ce rendez-vous vespéral littéraire : interviews, performances créatives, ou encore les recommandations de "booktubeurs".

programme.title: Groland le replait
programme.desc: Retrouvez les meilleurs moments des 7 Jours au Groland, et un résumé des dernières péripéties vécues par les habitants de la célèbre présipauté.

programme.title: Superintelligence
programme.desc: Depuis qu’elle a démissionné de son job et rompu avec George, Carol Peters mène une vie banale à Seattle, travaillant certains jours pour différentes associations caritatives. Un matin, elle reçoit un appel téléphonique d’un inconnu, qui semble connaître tout de sa vie et de son quotidien. Puis, sa télévision et sa cafetière se mettent en marche tout seul. Quand son autocuiseur se met à lui parler, Carol croît être devenu folle. En réalité, elle a été choisie par une technologie super intelligente qui l’observe afin d'en apprendre davantage sur l'humanité.

programme.title: Carnage chez les puppets
programme.desc: A Los Angeles, les humains coexistent depuis des années avec les marionnettes. Mais ces dernières, méprisées par les humains, sont régulièrement victimes de mauvais traitements. Phil Phillips, lui-même marionnette, ancien policier et désormais détective privé, reçoit la visite de Sandra White, une marionnette, victime d'un maître chanteur qui veut révéler ses turpitudes. Son enquête l'emmène aussitôt dans les bas-fonds de la ville, où semble sévir l'auteur de la lettre anonyme. Sur place, il rencontre une ancienne gloire des spectacles pour enfants.

programme.title: Mamie-sitter
programme.desc: Karin, retraitée sans enfants, s'ennuie un peu auprès de son mari Harald, passionné de trains miniatures et redoutablement casanier. Aussi, quand elle comprend qu'ils ne feront jamais le voyage en Nouvelle-Zélande qu'il lui avait promis, Karin suit l'exemple de Barbara, la dynamique soeur d'Harald, qui fut longtemps éducatrice et occupe désormais sa retraite en s'occupant d'un enfant quelques heures par semaine. Leur ami Gerhard, médecin, seul depuis la mort de son mari, vient d'enterrer leur chien et se retrouve dans la même situation de désarroi.

programme.title: Studio Bagel, la collection
programme.sub-title: Gilles et le tennis

programme.title: Hockey sur glace : NHL
programme.sub-title: Columbus Blue Jackets / Toronto Maple Leafs. NHL. 12e Semaine

programme.title: Ceux qui veulent ma mort
programme.desc: A Park County, dans le Montana, Hannah Faber, pompier parachutiste, reste traumatisée par une intervention au cours de laquelle elle n’est pas parvenue à sauver trois jeunes adolescents. Loin de là, Jack et Patrick Blackwell, deux tueurs, effacent méticuleusement les objets et les personnes qui pourraient gêner leurs employeurs. Quand il apprend leur dernière intervention, Owen Casserly, un comptable qui sait sa vie menacée, décide aussitôt de prendre la fuite avec son fils Connor. Ils font aussitôt route vers le Montana pour retrouver Ethan Sawyer, adjoint du shérif de Park County et ancien petit ami d’Hannah, pour solliciter sa protection.

programme.title: Le gala de Paul Mirabel (avec de l'aide)
programme.desc: En 2019, l'humoriste français Paul Mirabel s'est révélé au grand public lors du festival de l'humour de Montreux avec le sketch "Je me suis fait racketter". L'artiste montpelliérain revient en Suisse pour prendre les commandes du Gala de clôture de l'édition 2021 de ce rendez-vous de l'humour qui accueillent de nombreux jeunes talents. Dans son rôle de maître de cérémonie, Paul Mirabel sera épaulé par des stars confirmées ainsi que des fidèles de la scène de Montreux comme Thomas VDB, Nora Hamzawi, Roman Frayssinet, ou encore Caroline Vigneaux, Gad Elmaleh, Guillermo Guiz, Florence Foresti, Jamel Debbouze... De nombreux invités surprises transforment l'expérience en bizutage sympathique.

programme.title: Groland le replait
programme.desc: Retrouvez les meilleurs moments des 7 Jours au Groland, et un résumé des dernières péripéties vécues par les habitants de la célèbre présipauté.

programme.title: Hockey sur glace : NHL
programme.sub-title: Vegas Golden Knights / Colorado Avalanche. NHL. 12e Semaine

programme.title: La personne aux deux personnes
programme.desc: Gilles Gabriel, qui, dans les années 1980, a connu un petit succès comme chanteur, meurt au volant de sa voiture après avoir renversé Jean-Christian Ranu, obscur comptable dans une multinationale. Manifestation paranormale ou plaisanterie divine ? L'esprit de Gilles s'est transporté dans le corps du comptable. Le malheureux Ranu a donc désormais deux personnalités qui cohabitent dans son cerveau. Au début, la chose s'avère difficile mais, très vite, les deux hommes commencent à s'apprécier et, sous l'impulsion de Gilles, le terne et solitaire Jean-Christian prend peu à peu de l'assurance.

programme.title: Poly
programme.desc: Dans la France des années 1960, Louise Delvinne vient de divorcer. Alors que son ex-mari est parti en Italie, Louise quitte Paris avec leur fille Cécile, âgée de 10 ans, pour s'installer dans un petit village du Vaucluse. Sur place, Louise, infirmière diplômée, tente de retrouver une activité, en espérant que les habitants du village acceptent son statut de parisienne divorcée. Cécile, de son côté, a du mal à lier avec les enfants du village et croise bientôt le chemin de l'étrange monsieur Victor. C'est alors qu'un cirque itinérant arrive au village.

programme.title: Fin des programmes
programme.desc: Nos programmes se terminent pour cette journée, en attendant ceux de demain.

programme.title: Groland le replait
programme.desc: Retrouvez les meilleurs moments des 7 Jours au Groland, et un résumé des dernières péripéties vécues par les habitants de la célèbre présipauté.

De nombreux invités surprises transforment l'expérience en bizutage sympathique.

programme.title: Adieu les cons
programme.desc: A 43 ans, Suze Trappet, apprend qu'elle est atteinte d'une maladie qui ne lui laisse plus que peu de temps à vivre. Elle décide alors de retrouver le fils dont elle a du accoucher sous X quand elle avait quinze ans. Parallèlement, Jean-Baptiste Cuchas, la cinquantaine, brillant chef de la sécurité informatique d'une administration française, déprimé fortement quand il comprend qu'on le pousse vers la sortie. Leurs deux destins se croisent quand Suze vient faire une demande administrative non loin du bureau où Jean-Baptiste sème le chaos en tentant de suicider.

programme.title: Groland le replait
programme.desc: Retrouvez les meilleurs moments des 7 Jours au Groland, et un résumé des dernières péripéties vécues par les habitants de la célèbre présipauté.
